chunk_analysis.page_text:
This Indenture

Made the 26th day of October, 1984,

Between JAMES G. HATHAWAY and MARY ANN HATHAWAY, his wife, of R. D. #1, Carmichaels, Greene County, Pennsylvania,

parties of the first part and

BRIAN HATHAWAY, of Carmichaels, Greene County, Pennsylvania 15320

party of the second part:

Witnesseth, that the said parties of the first part, in consideration of
One and no/100 ($1.00) Dollar

to them now paid by the said party of the second part, do grant, bargain, sell and convey unto the said party of the second part, his heirs and assigns,

All that certain tract of land situate in Cumberland Township, Greene County, Pennsylvania, bounded and described as follows:

BEGINNING at a point, corner to lands formerly of Samuel Bunting; thence by lands formerly of Samuel Hathaway, North 48° West 33.05 perches to a stone; thence by the same and lands formerly of James K. Gregg, North 3° West 24.97 perches to a stone; thence by lands formerly of James Keris Heirs, North 56° 30' West 114 perches to a stone in the road; thence by lands formerly of Samuel Horner, South 8° 21' East 25.88 perches to a stone in road; thence by same, South 41° 30' West 27.32 perches to a stone in road; thence by same, South 27° 30' West 9.82 perches to a stone in road; thence by same, South 10° 15' West 10 perches to a stone in road; thence by the same, South 22° 45' East 30.4 perches to a stone in road; thence by the same, South 36° 30' East 24.17 perches to a stone in the road; thence by lands now or formerly of Pennington and Crow,

South 33° 30' East 31.55 perches to a stone in the road by lot formerly of G. W. Dougherty; thence by same, North 57° 30' East 8.85 perches to a stone; thence by same, South 31° East 25.75 perches to a stone at a wing wall of an old bridge; thence South 68° 30' East 16.03 perches to a stone; thence North 47° East 17.65 perches to a White Oak; thence North 00° 41' West 6.69 perches to a White Oak; thence North 52° West 13.5 perches to a stone; thence North 6° 15' East 25.66 perches to a stone in Muddy Creek; thence North 48° 30' East 10 perches to a stone in said Creek; thence South 83° 30' East 16.58 perches to a stone in said Creek; thence South 36° East 41.5 perches to a stone in Muddy Creek; thence by land formerly of Samuel Bunting, North 21° East 17 perches to the place of BEGINNING.

CONTAINING 60 Acres and 86 Perches.

EXCEPTING and RESERVING 4.6410 Acres heretofore conveyed to Dolores H. Waggett by deed dated 1974 and recorded in Deed Book Vol. 596, Page 1005.

SUBJECT to the EXCEPTIONS and RESERVATIONS contained in deed of Edward Hathaway, et ux., et al., to Thomas Hathaway, recorded in Deed Book Vol. 470, Page 372.

FURTHER, EXCEPTING and RESERVING to the grantors herein all other veins of coal, oil and gas and other minerals within and underlying said tract together with mining and drilling rights except that no surface rights for strip mining are herein reserved. However, there is granted by this conveyance to Brian Hathaway, his heirs and assigns, the right to receive free gas for residential purposes from any well presently or in the future drilled upon the premises.

BEING a part of Tract No. 1 in deed from Dolores H. Waggett, et con., et al., to James C. Hathaway and Mary Ann Hathaway, his wife, by deed dated March 29, 1969, recorded in Deed Book Vol. 555, Page 97.

THE ACTUAL CONSIDERATION for this conveyance is $35,000.00.

[Commonwealth of Pennsylvania Department of Revenue Realty Transfer Tax stamp showing $350.00]

detailed_samples.reasoning: This document contains a clear and explicit mineral rights reservation in the following substantive passage:
This document contains an actual, explicit mineral rights reservation as evidenced by this specific language:
This document contains an actual, explicit mineral rights reservation in the following substantive clause:

However, there is granted by this conveyance to Brian Hathaway, his heirs and assigns, the right to receive free gas for residential purposes from any well presently or in the future drilled upon the premises.

BEING a part of Tract No. 1 in deed from Dolores H. Waggett, et con., et al., to James C. Hathaway and Mary Ann Hathaway, his wife, by deed dated March 29, 1969, recorded in Deed Book Vol. 555, Page 97.

THE ACTUAL CONSIDERATION for this conveyance is $35,000.00.

[Commonwealth of Pennsylvania Department of Revenue Realty Transfer Tax stamp showing $350.00]
